TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Span extends System.Windows.Documents.Inline

Docs.summary: Groups other <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Inline"> flow content elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Span is used to group other inline flow content elements together. No inherent rendering is applied to content or other elements within a Span element.
Span enforces a strong content model for child content. Child elements contained in a Span element must be derived from <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline>. Valid child elements include:
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Bold>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Figure>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Floater>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Hyperlink>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineUIContainer>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Italic>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.LineBreak>
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run>
- Span
- <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Underline>

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new, empty instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Documents.Inline childInline) cil managed

Docs.param: The initial contents of the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span">.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> class with the specified <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> object as the initial contents.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor to create a new Span that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run>.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_span_const1)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_span_const1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Documents.Inline childInline, class System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer insertionPosition) cil managed

Docs.param: An <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Inline"> object that specifies the initial contents of the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>. This parameter may be null, in which case no <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Inline"> is inserted.

A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"> that specifies the position at which to insert the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element after it is created, or null for no automatic insertion.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> class, taking a specified <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> object as the initial contents of the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span">, and a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> that specifies an insertion position for the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> element.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> that contains a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> inserted at the start of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Paragraph>.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const2](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_span_const2)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const2](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_span_const2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer start, class System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer end) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"> that indicates the beginning of a selection of content that the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> will contain.
A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer"> that indicates the end of a selection of content that the new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> will contain.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> class, taking two <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> objects that indicate the beginning and end of a selection of content that the new <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> will contain.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor is intended to initialize a new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element such that it encloses a selection of pre-existing content.
## Examples The following example shows how to use this constructor to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> that is applied to a range of content. The range of content is determined by the start and end <xref:System.Windows.Documents.TextPointer> objects specified by the constructor.
[!code-cs[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const3](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/SpanSnippets/Window1.xaml.cs#_span_const3)] [!code-vb[SpanSnippets#_Span_Const3](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/spansnippets/window1.xaml.vb#_span_const3)]
The following figure shows how this example renders in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FlowDocument>.
![Screenshot: Three text runs](../../add/media/span-grouping.png "Screenshot: Three text runs")

Docs.summary: Gets an <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"> containing the top-level <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>.
Docs.value:
An <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection"> containing the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Inline> elements that comprise the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>.
This property has no default value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.InlineCollection> returned by this property to enumerate or manipulate the contents of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ShouldSerializeInlines(class System.Windows.Markup.XamlDesignerSerializationManager manager) cil managed

Docs.param: A serialization service manager object for this object.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the content of a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Documents.Span"> element should be serialized during serialization of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Run> object.
Docs.returns: `true` if the content should be serialized; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This `ShouldSerialize` method is provided because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span.Inlines%2A> property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span> or developing your own control incorporating the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Span>.
